definitions.definition: a feeling of reassurance and relaxation following release from anxiety or distress.
examples: much to her relief, she saw the door open
synonyms: solace "it was such a relief to share my worries"

definitions.definition: a cause of or occasion for relief.
the alleviation of pain, discomfort, or distress.
examples: tablets for the relief of pain

definitions.definition: a temporary break in a generally tense or tedious situation.
examples: the comic characters aren't part of the plot but just light relief

definitions.definition: assistance, especially in the form of food, clothing, or money, given to those in special need or difficulty.
synonyms: donations "the role of the voluntary organizations in providing relief to the victims"

definitions.definition: a remission of tax normally due.
examples: people who donate money to charity will receive tax relief

definitions.definition: the redress of a hardship or grievance.
the action of raising the siege of a besieged town.
a person or group of people replacing others who have been on duty.
synonyms: understudy "his relief arrived to take over"

definitions.definition: the role of a relief pitcher.
the state of being clearly visible or obvious due to being accentuated in some way.
examples: the setting sun threw the snow-covered peaks into relief

definitions.definition: a method of molding, carving, or stamping in which the design stands out from the surface, to a greater ( high relief ) or lesser ( bas-relief ) extent.
a piece of sculpture in relief.
a representation of relief given by an arrangement of line or color or shading.
difference in height from the surrounding terrain; the amount of variation in elevation and slope in a particular area.
